intro: Bartschella hutchisoniana subsp. louisae, commonly known as the Louisiana bartschella, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Louisiana. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant prefers moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetland habitats. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it has a low-growing habit. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
